title.narrative: Particulate air pollution project in India

description.narrative: The Finnish Meteorological Institute (FMI) and an Indian TERI Institute will implement a project in 2010-2012 which continues research on particulate air pollution in Southern Asia. The new phase is continuation of the previous project started in 2006. By measuring the particulate air pollution over a period of several years it is possible to follow the long-term trends to find out what is happening to the particulate concentrations and what is the impact on climate and health. The research capacity of TERI will also be improved and the research findings will be disseminated to various stakeholders. TERI is willing to continue the cooperation with FMI.
